title: Aluminum Rises to Over 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK rose past $2,900 per tonne in October 2025, reaching the highest level in over three years amid tight near-term supply and bullish long-term demand. China, the top producer, emphasized preventing overcapacity in metal production to maintain market balance.

title: US Aluminium Premiums Surge Following 2025 Tariff Increases
summary: The US aluminum market experienced a record surge in premiums after the US administration doubled tariffs on aluminum imports from 25% to 50% in June 2025. This led to a 190% increase in the US Midwest duty-paid premium compared to November 2024, severely restricting aluminum flow into the US market.

title: LME WEEK: US aluminum price rise spurs deliveries from Canada
summary: US aluminum prices have risen to around $2,750 per ton on the London Metal Exchange, with the Midwest premium reaching a record $0.77 per lb ($1,697 per ton) in early October 2025. This premium fully prices in the 50% US tariff on aluminum imports, leading to increased but not yet full-scale deliveries from Canada, which remains a major supplier.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: The US government increased tariffs on steel and aluminum imports to 50% in 2025, aiming to protect domestic manufacturing. The American Iron and Steel Institute supports the tariff hike, citing ongoing global overcapacity led by China. The tariff increase impacts prices and trade flows, with potential tempering effects from resumed production at US steel plants.

title: The most-traded cast aluminium contract approaches the RMB 21,000 per tonne mark, maintaining a short-term rising trend
summary: Cast aluminium alloy futures in China rose 0.77% to RMB 20,965 per tonne on November 3, 2025, supported by low scrap supply and stable demand for ADC12 alloy. The market shows a short-term upward trend amid these supply-demand dynamics.

title: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory in Two Regions Rises to 99,500 mt on Nov 3, 2025: SMM
summary: Aluminum billet inventory in two major domestic regions in China has increased to 99,500 metric tons as of November 3, 2025, according to SMM data. The report also notes that a Shandong-based aluminum enterprise has announced a higher November 2025 prebaked anode tender benchmark price.

title: Commonwealth Rolled Products, MetalX form partnership to advance sustainable aluminum production
summary: Commonwealth Rolled Products and MetalX have announced a partnership aimed at advancing sustainable aluminum production. The collaboration focuses on developing more environmentally friendly aluminum manufacturing processes.

title: Aluminum-air long-duration generation technology selected by Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers for Groundbreaking Clean Backup Energy Initiative in Data Centers
summary: Phinergy's aluminum-air backup solution was selected by the Net Zero Innovation Hub for Data Centers as a key technology to accelerate the transition to net-zero operations. This technology offers a clean, scalable alternative to diesel backup generators and will be scaled to MW level for deployment in live data center environments.

title: When going green becomes the new profit curve for aluminium. Or does it?
summary: The aluminium industry faces a critical juncture with an expected 80% rise in demand by 2050 amid pressure to reduce emissions. Retrofitting smelters with inert-anode technology is seen as the only credible way to eliminate direct emissions, but requires significant upfront investment estimated at USD 200 billion by 2050, posing economic challenges for the sector.

title: First brake caliper made from 100% recycled aluminium sets a benchmark in sustainability
summary: Brembo introduced a brake caliper made entirely from recycled aluminium, reducing CO₂ emissions by 70% over the component's lifecycle without compromising design or performance. This innovation marks a significant step forward in sustainable automotive component manufacturing.

title: The 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit 2025 to Tackle Sustainability and Policy Challenges
summary: The upcoming 3rd European Green Aluminium Summit, scheduled for November 11-12, 2025 in Düsseldorf, Germany, will gather industry leaders and policymakers to discuss decarbonisation challenges in the aluminium sector. Key topics include green aluminium production, recycling, circular economy, and EU regulations such as the Carbon Border Adjustment Mechanism (CBAM).

title: Steel Prices Fall in China, Down 6.78% Year-on-Year
summary: Steel prices in China fell to 3,067 CNY/T on October 31, 2025, down 0.68% from the previous day and 6.78% compared to the same time last year. Analysts expect prices to continue declining, with forecasts of 3,039.40 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and 2,904.76 in 12 months.

title: HRC Steel Prices Rise 5.58% Over Past Month, Up 19.19% Year-on-Year
summary: HRC (hot-rolled coil) steel prices increased to 851 USD/T on October 31, 2025, up 0.12% from the previous day and 19.19% compared to last year. Prices are expected to rise further, with forecasts of 864.45 USD/T by the end of the quarter and 934.57 in 12 months.

title: Steel Market Update: Buyers Expect Moderate Price Gains Into 2026
summary: Most steel buyers anticipate continued price increases into 2026, though not at the rapid pace seen in previous market upturns. The article also highlights Nucor's focus on supplying the data center boom and Gerdau's improved North American earnings due to reduced imports.

title: Goldman Sachs Lifts Iron Ore Price Outlook Amid Resilient Chinese Production
summary: Goldman Sachs has raised its 2026 iron ore price forecast to $93/tonne, citing macroeconomic support and steady Chinese steel production. However, the bank expects prices to drop to $88/tonne by late 2026 due to potential weakness in China's steel sector.

title: CEMCO Announces Price Increase on All Steel-Based Products
summary: CEMCO will implement a price increase on all steel-based products for all markets effective November 3, 2025. New price sheets will be available from sales representatives.

title: Steel Prices in the First Week of November 2025
summary: Current FOB prices for key steel products include rebar at $490 (CIS), wire rod at $555 (Turkey), HR coil at $455 (Russia), and CR coil at $555 (Turkey). These figures reflect regional market conditions as of early November 2025.

title: 2Q 2025 Cost Report: As Steel, Aluminum Tariffs Rise to 50%, Feds OK US Steel Sale to Nippon Steel
summary: U.S. steel and aluminum tariffs have risen to 50%, with the American Iron and Steel Institute supporting the move to curb Chinese imports. Cleveland-Cliffs and AK Steel are now the sole U.S. producers of grain-oriented electrical steel, while Nippon Steel's acquisition of U.S. Steel includes plans to restart idled blast furnace capacity.

title: Steel industry pushes for stronger safeguard duties to check cheap imports
summary: Indian steelmakers are urging the government to impose stronger safeguard duties to combat rising steel imports, especially from China. Despite increased exports, India remains a net importer, with domestic stainless steel capacity utilization at only 60% due to cheap imports.

title: Iron ore slips on declining steel production, rising inventories in China
summary: Iron ore futures prices have softened due to declining steel production and rising inventories in China. This reflects ongoing concerns about demand and overcapacity in the Chinese steel sector.

title: Iran's Arfa Iron and Steel Company's production increases
summary: Iran's Arfa Iron and Steel Company reported a 5% increase in production during the first seven months of the current year. Further details are available to subscribers.

title: ArcelorMittal gets environmental clearance for Anakapalli steel plant in Andhra
summary: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel (AM/NS) has received environmental clearance for its 8.2 million tonnes per annum greenfield integrated steel plant in Andhra Pradesh, India. The facility will use advanced, energy-efficient, and low-emission technologies meeting global sustainability standards, marking India's largest greenfield steel manufacturing initiative.

title: Centre gives green clearance to planned AMNS steel plant at Nakkapalli
summary: The Union Ministry of Environment, Forests and Climate Change has recommended environmental clearance for the ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel (AMNS) plant in Andhra Pradesh, with an initial capacity of 8.2 million tonnes per annum. The plant will use advanced, energy-efficient, and low-emission technologies, supporting India's sustainable steel production ambitions.

title: Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cut in December Decline LME Copper Fluctuates and Closes Lower Last Friday
summary: LME copper futures opened at $10,857.5/mt and fluctuated during the session, closing slightly lower at $10,891.5/mt, down 0.35%. Anglo American reported declining ore grades at its Collahuasi copper mine in Chile, with production constrained next year and expected to normalize only by 2027.

title: Copper declines for third day on concerns Over China's economy
summary: Copper prices on the London Metal Exchange fell 0.3% to $10,854 a ton amid concerns about China's slowing manufacturing activity and economic health. Despite a recent record high fueled by easing US-China trade tensions and supply disruptions, prices have pulled back as the market remains cautious about demand prospects.

title: Copper Prices in London Hit Record High on Supply Fears
summary: LME three-month copper futures reached a record high of $11,173.50 a metric ton driven by supply concerns after disruptions at major mines and lowered production forecasts from producers like Glencore and Anglo American. The previous record was $11,104.50 set in May 2024.

title: Copper Miners Plunge Amid US-China Tensions
summary: Shares in Australian copper mining companies fell sharply due to copper price declines linked to escalating US-China tensions. The geopolitical uncertainty has raised fears of reduced global demand, especially from China, impacting copper prices and miners' market valuations.

title: Expectations for US Fed Interest Rate Cut in December Decline LME Copper Fluctuates and Closes Lower Last Friday [SMM Copper Morning Meeting Minutes]
summary: LME copper prices fluctuated and closed lower last Friday, with declining expectations for a US Fed interest rate cut in December. The most-traded SHFE copper contract also saw a slight decrease, reflecting ongoing market volatility.

title: Anglo–Teck alliance reshapes global copper outlook
summary: The merger between Anglo American and Teck is set to create one of the most powerful forces in global copper supply, with combined production nearing one million tonnes annually and significant synergies expected from major South American assets. The merger is expected to deliver additional copper output and reshape global supply chains.

title: Ivanhoe Q3 profits shrink on copper mine disruption
summary: Ivanhoe Mines reported a significant drop in Q3 profits due to disruptions at its Kamoa-Kakula copper complex in the Democratic Republic of the Congo, caused by seismic activity and flooding. Production and sales declined sharply, though the company remains on track to meet its revised annual guidance.

title: China's Strategic Control of Global Copper Refining Supply Chain
summary: China continues to dominate global copper refining capacity, with plans to add 2.5 million tonnes of new capacity by 2028. Despite efforts to diversify refining capacity elsewhere, China's infrastructure advantages and expansion plans are expected to maintain its market leadership for the next decade.

title: Copper Miners Plunge Amid US-China Tensions
summary: Shares in Australian copper mining companies fell sharply due to escalating US-China tensions, which have raised concerns about reduced global copper demand and potential supply chain disruptions. The market reaction reflects heightened uncertainty over trade relations and their impact on commodity prices.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in the first half of 2025 but stabilized in Q3 due to ongoing oversupply concerns driven mainly by rapid production growth in Indonesia. Despite rising demand, the market remains structurally oversupplied, with London Metal Exchange (LME) nickel stockpiles increasing from 164,028 MT at the start of 2025 to 231,504 MT by the end of Q3. The end of the US EV tax credit on September 30 may also impact future nickel demand in the electric vehicle sector.

title: Nickel prices were in the doldrums on November 3 with US Q3 economic growth expected to approach 4%
summary: On November 3, the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 122,000 yuan/mt, a slight increase of 50 yuan/mt from the previous day. The nickel market showed subdued price movement amid broader economic expectations of US Q3 growth nearing 4%.

title: Nickel fell to 15,210.75 USD/T on November 3, 2025, down 0.26% from the previous day
summary: Nickel prices declined slightly by 0.26% to 15,210.75 USD per tonne on November 3, continuing a downward trend over the past month with a 1.65% fall. The price is also down 5.64% compared to the same time last year, reflecting ongoing market pressures and expectations of further price decreases over the next year.

title: Nickel Price Index, Trend, Chart 2025 and Forecast
summary: Nickel prices in October 2025 were 17.24 USD/kg in Northeast Asia, 16.19 USD/kg in Europe, and 15.94 USD/kg in North America, showing regional variations with a slight decline in Northeast Asia. IMARC Group provides monthly updated pricing data and forecasts, supporting strategic decisions in procurement and investments across global markets.

title: Nickel Mines Ltd. Reports Strong Q3 2025 Performance Amid Strategic Financial Moves
summary: Nickel Mines Ltd. reported significant EBITDA growth in its RKEF and HPAL operations during Q3 2025 despite a temporary dip in sales from its Hengjaya Mine. The company issued US$800 million in senior unsecured notes to refinance debt, reducing costs and extending maturities, while also achieving safety milestones and advancing production quotas.

title: Terra Metals Multi-Metal Discovery at Southwest Prospects
summary: Terra Metals Ltd revealed a multi-metal discovery with thick titanium-sulfide reefs containing elevated cobalt, copper, nickel, and PGM values. With 49 drill holes completed and 45 pending assays, the discovery shows significant expansion potential, positioning the company for growth amid rising cobalt prices and ongoing exploration.

title: PAM Mineral Nine-Month Profit Surges 131% on Higher Sales Volume
summary: IDX-listed nickel mining company PT PAM Mineral Tbk reported a 131% profit increase over nine months driven by higher sales volume, reflecting strong operational performance in nickel production.

title: Nickel Price Update: Q3 2025 in Review
summary: Nickel prices were volatile in early 2025 but stabilized in Q3 amid oversupply concerns mainly due to rapid production growth in Indonesia. Despite rising demand, the market remains structurally oversupplied, with LME nickel stockpiles increasing significantly through Q3 2025.

title: Nickel Futures Fall to Over 1-Month Low on Oversupply from Indonesia
summary: Nickel futures dropped below $15,100 per tonne, the lowest in over a month, due to oversupply from Indonesia's booming production. Indonesian nickel intermediates flooding global supply chains have pushed LME inventories to record highs, prompting regulatory tightening to stabilize output and prices.

title: Announcement on the Addition of the 'MHP Cobalt Payable to SMM Cobalt Metal (in-whs Rotterdam)' Price Point
summary: SMM announced the publication of a new price point for MHP cobalt payable to SMM cobalt metal in Rotterdam starting November 5, 2025. This reflects market demand for greater price transparency and standardization amid supply shortages of cobalt intermediate products affecting nickel intermediate prices.

title: Why Nickel is Set to Skyrocket: The EV and Renewable Energy Revolution
summary: Nickel demand is surging due to its critical role in electric vehicle (EV) batteries and renewable energy storage systems. Companies like PT. Anugrah Neo Energy Materials are producing advanced nickel materials aligned with environmental, social, and governance (ESG) standards to support the clean energy transition.

title: Nickel Mining 2025: Sustainable Growth In Asia
summary: Asia's nickel mining industry is adopting advanced technologies such as automation, AI analytics, and water recycling to enhance sustainability. Indonesia and the Philippines lead in responsible sourcing and environmental practices to meet rising demand from EV and stainless steel markets.

title: Mustard plants: Nature's new miners for sustainable nickel extraction
summary: Researchers are exploring the use of genetically studied mustard plants to extract nickel from soil sustainably. By delaying flowering and enhancing nickel uptake genes, this phytomining approach could offer an environmentally friendly alternative to traditional mining.

title: Genomines raises $45M to grow nickel from plants, not mines
summary: French start-up Genomines secured $45 million to scale its innovative phytoextraction technology that uses plants to extract nickel from soil. This method can convert low-grade land into productive assets faster and more sustainably than traditional mining, producing nickel concentrates with higher purity.

title: Indonesia's nickel mining for EV boom threatens environment
summary: Indonesia, the world's top nickel producer, faces environmental challenges as its nickel mining expands to meet EV battery demand. While the sector boosts the economy, concerns about pollution and biodiversity loss in tropical forests and mangroves are rising.

title: Italy's Tenaris posts surprise 2% rise in sales on stable US, Canada drilling
summary: Italian steel pipe maker Tenaris reported a 2% increase in third-quarter net sales to $2.98 billion, driven by stable drilling activity in the US and Canada, offsetting weaker regions. Despite this revenue rise, the company warned that margins would be impacted by the full effect of tariff costs on steel imports.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: At the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, Tenaris highlighted its steel solutions tailored for power generation, focusing on quality, innovation, and sustainability. The company emphasized its long-term partnership with Macchi and investments in manufacturing capabilities to produce high-performance tubular products for demanding energy applications.

title: Tenaris in Italy achieves ASME certification for the supply of materials for the nuclear sector
summary: Tenaris's Dalmine mill in Italy obtained ASME certification, qualifying it to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities built to ASME III standards. This accreditation supports Tenaris's role in the global energy transition by enabling supply for nuclear power plants, a key low-carbon energy source.

title: Tenaris Announces Second Tranche of USD 600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris initiated the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, authorizing a financial institution to repurchase up to $600 million of shares starting November 3, 2025, through April 30, 2026. The repurchased shares will be canceled, potentially increasing earnings per share and reflecting confidence in the company's financial position.

title: Tenaris Launches $600M Second Tranche Under $1.2B Buyback
summary: Tenaris announced the start of the second tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, with purchases beginning November 3, 2025, and ending by April 30, 2026. The buyback complies with EU market abuse regulations, and all repurchased shares will be canceled, supporting shareholder value.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded a tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia under the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and involves laying cables at depths up to 800 meters in the Strait of Sicily, enhancing energy security between Europe and Africa.

title: Prysmian lifts 2025 outlook after Q3 beat on strong transmission growth
summary: Prysmian SpA raised its full-year 2025 guidance after reporting third-quarter revenue of €5.03 billion, beating expectations. The growth was driven by strong performance in Renewable Transmission and Power Grids segments, with a stable high-voltage backlog of about €16 billion, reflecting robust demand for cables including copper cables in Italy and globally.
